content.description:
Amazing route in a remote location. Great rock. Techy.

 Follow the left-leaning seam (crux) to the horizontal break, then up the face above with water grooves and occasional crimps.
content.protection: Seven quickdraws. Stick clip! Fixed anchor.
content.location: On the Raven Wall (see directions in the area overview). Left side, locate a sheer, 50'-tall wall split by a horizontal break. Begin at a left-leaning seam.

content.description: Up the crack past two flared sections to the top. Fixed anchor on tree.
content.location: At a snaking, overhanging handcrack and 15' right of the toe of the cliff.

content.description:
Ice Cave Mountain is a long ridge with many small cliffs in a very remote location near North Lake. The most accessible cliff is on a tiny summit and is a popular day hike, as it has deep fissures that hold ice throughout the summer. The climbs here are mostly moderate, with the most important feature being high-quality, naturally clean rock. The fact that the rock here is clean is an anomaly; the entire cliff seems as if it's been power-washed. 

  The Fissure Face is the cliff on the most accessible summit, and faces west-ish.
